Class Eshmun

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component

  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class Eshmun
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The Main Frame, contains the application's entry point.

    1.0
    Author:
    Kinan Dak Al Bab

    • Constructor Detail

      • Eshmun

        public Eshmun(StructureType structureType)
        Constructs a new instance of the application for a given structure type.

        This entails constructing the Menu on top, the GraphPanelContainer (and its contents), The LogicTextPanes (both Specifications and Structure), and the Message, information labels.

        Parameters:
        structureType - the Type of structure the application is going to serve.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        Parameters:

      • resizeBottomPanel

        private void resizeBottomPanel(java.awt.Dimension size,
                               boolean resizeHeight,
                               int extra)
        Resize the bottom panel with the frame resize.
        Parameters:
        size - the new size of the frame.
        resizeHeight - flags whether the resize is Height and width wise, or just width wise.
        extra - extra height for the panel in pixels (when the splitter is moved).

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String[] processes)
        Checks if either the name or all the processes given exist already in a structure
        Parameters:

        processes - the processes to look for.
        Returns:

        public void stateByStateModelCheck()

      • modelRepair

        private boolean modelRepair(boolean callback)
        Attempts repairing this model.
        Parameters:
        callback - callback the switch buttons.
        Returns:
        true if model was repaired, false otherwise.

      • nextRepair

        public boolean nextRepair()
        Traverses to the next repair.
        Returns:
        true if there exist a new repair, false otherwise.

      • previousRepair

        public boolean previousRepair()
        Traverses to the previous repair.
        Returns:
        true if there exist a previous repair, false otherwise.

      • unsatCore

        public void unsatCore()

      • isAbstracted

        public boolean isAbstracted()
        Checks if the model is already abstracted.
        Returns:
        true if the model is abstracted, false otherwise.

      • abstractByLabel

        public void abstractByLabel()
        Abstracts the model by label. If model is already abstracted does nothing.

      • abstractByFormula

        public void abstractByFormula()
        Abstracts the model by formula. If model is already abstracted does nothing.

      • concretize

        public void concretize()
        Concretizes the abstracted model.

      • resetAbstraction

        public void resetAbstraction()
        Resets the abstraction, reverts back to old model.

      • generatePairs

        public void generatePairs(int processNum,
                          boolean ring)
        Takes the current single Kripke Structure, and generate isomorphic pairs for the specified number of processes, with their specs.
        Parameters:
        processNum - the number of processes.
        ring - true if the pairs must be generated on a ring, false if all pairs.

      • extractPairSpecs

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> extractPairSpecs()
                                                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Extracts templates from all the structures currently in Eshmun.
        Returns:
        a list of definitions (scripting language style).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if eshmun does not contain valid Kripke or MultiKripke Structures.

      • extractPairSpecs

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> extractPairSpecs(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> structureNames)
                                                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Extracts templates from all the structures currently in Eshmun whose name appear in the given set.
        Parameters:
        structureNames - a set of structure names to consider, null means consider all.
        Returns:
        a list of definitions (scripting language style).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if eshmun does not contain valid Kripke or MultiKripke Structures.

      • toSynchSkeletons

        public void toSynchSkeletons()
        Transforms the structure in Eshmun to a collection of Synchronization skeletons, then loads it to the screen.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the current structure being converted has an invalid type or components.

      • getTransitionColor

        public java.awt.Color getTransitionColor(java.lang.String processName)
        Gets the color of the transition according to its process.

        Returns:
        the transition color.

        Returns:

      • getProcessColor

        public java.awt.Color getProcessColor(java.lang.String processName)
        Gets the color attached to the given process (whether transition or state).
        Parameters:
        processName - the process name.
        Returns:
        the process color.

      • getActionColor

        public java.awt.Color getActionColor(java.lang.String actionName)
        Gets the color attached to the given action.
        Parameters:
        actionName - the name of the action for which to get the color.
        Returns:
        the action color.

      • getColoredProcessNames

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getColoredProcessNames()
        Returns:
        all the process names of processes with colors.

      • setAlphaForProcessColor

        public void setAlphaForProcessColor(java.lang.String process,
                                    int alpha)
        Sets the alpha component of the color of the given process. the alpha component controls transparency, if alpha is 0 the color is fully transparent, if alpha is 255 the color is not.
        Parameters:
        process - the name of the process to set the alpha for.
        alpha - the new alpha value ranging between 0 (transparent) and 255(not transparent).

      • switchColorMode

        public void switchColorMode(Eshmun.ColorMode mode)
        Changes the color mode currently used, this changes the colors already picked to the new mode, and guarantees that new colors are generated in that mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode of coloring.

      • getNewRandomColor

        public java.awt.Color getNewRandomColor()
        Gets a new random color, guaranteed to be unique.
        Returns:
        a random color.

      • letUserChooseColors

        public void letUserChooseColors()
        Shows a dialog through which the user can change/choose the colors of the processes.

      • setRefinementCurrent

        public void setRefinementCurrent(int current)
        Sets the current structure in the refinement
        Parameters:
        current - the current index of the structure in refinement.
